alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, southwestern Greensville and southeastern Brunswick Counties through 330 PM EST... At 259 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gasburg, or 11 miles northwest of Roanoke Rapids, moving north at 35 mph. This storm has been exhibiting weak rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Barley around 305 PM EST. Brunswick around 310 PM EST. Lawrenceville and Radium around 325 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ante, Triplet, Edgerton, Pleasant Shade, Henrico, Vultare, Valentines, Roanoke Rapids Lake and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia.
